page.title: 19Superstitions and Sayings.
page.content: Because there are few inhabitants indigenous to the area local superstitions and sayings are difficult to record. The few discovered have been given by local women all of whom at some time or other have worked for the Lopes household and/or Maristow Estate. "No one should buy a broom in May for fear of brushing someone out the door" "Touch your cap/forelock to a lone magpie and say,'Good morning Mr Magpie', otherwise bad luck will befall you". "If when standing at 'Pound' you hear a train crossing Warleigh bridge it's going to rain. If you hear traffic on the main road it's going to be a fine day". The pub "Who'd Have Thought It", is supposed to be haunted by a'crinolin' lady and an ex-landlord, Abe Beer.
